Comment 2 by **nautigar**: 
True, but the EBNF sould specify the syntax, while the surrounding plain text should add
the semantics. If "const a,b,c" is considered syntactically correct (but semantically
wrong) by the language specification, the compiler should not emit a "syntax error".
I found it confusing because the ConstDecl syntax differs from the VarDecl syntax for no
obvious reason. That's why I stumbled over it.
